place_description: Award winning Craft Brewery and Taproom in North End Charlotte situated between Avid Exchange Music Factory, Camp North End, and Optimist Hall. Kid and Dog- friendly. Offering Craft Beer, Cider, Seltzer, Sours, Wines, Kombucha, CBD seltzers, and Snacks. Food Truck schedule posted weekly on Instagram. Family- Friendly. Open- air patio with Skyline views. Pub- style taproom welcoming to all, with secret room- a blend of library, speakeasy, church, cigar lounge, and dive bar. A hidden gem hiding in plain sight.

reviews_data.review_text: We absolutely loved this place! The beer selection was fantastic, and the atmosphere was one of the best we've experienced. There was plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors. During our visit, we chose to sit indoors, where a live band was playing. While the music was a bit louder than we'd prefer, it provided great background noise as we played cards. Overall, we highly recommend this spot if you're looking for a fun and lively place to enjoy with friends.
Cute space, love the hidden game room, great views, and the bartenders were attentive. Will hang out here again!
We got the Hazy IPA and really liked it.  Definitely a cool and different vibe.  Great patio.  Will be back.
Cool place to hang out for a pint.  They have food trucks. Mr Charles Chicken is also nearby.  The beers are top notch.  We like their pilsners. Do not forget to visit the secret room.
Had the Pilsner & the Vienna Lager - enjoyed them both.
Coolest and most unique brewery atmosphere in Charlotte

'Art is theft',.. Creative cool name, and I dig the brewery's inspiration.

The indoor space is like a chic mix of an industrial coffee shop and Capone era bookstore. Great ambiance for a few beers with some live music.

I only had 1 beer, which, for me, was decent but nothing over the top.  I'd definitely make another stop when I'm back in Charlotte to give a few more selections a go.  Try it out!

This is an awesome gem of a brewery. Interior feels like a book store.
My favorite beers right now are
White Lotus (Pilsner)
Haymaker (Kolsch)
Hunting attire (Oktoberfest lager)
Disco Volante ( Honey Lager , just a tiny bit sweet)
Relic (Pale ale)
Burden of Boredom (Nitro fruited Blonde - has an awesome head)

I guess you can tell I have been there a few time
Amazing seltzers, food trucks, dog friendly.... The atmosphere is so cool!
If you like breweries this place is a must-visit! Great beer, friendly staff, and a super unique venue with fantastic decorations. I would give it more than 5 stars if I could!
Good beer and eclectic atmosphere.  Constantly rotating taps means there is usually something for everyone.

The atmosphere is relaxing rather unique. They have a variety of 10 or so different beers on tap and a nice outdoor patio to enjoy them as well as a private room speakeasy type room the venture into. This location has great proximity to music factory and uptown

Recommended to us by Divine Barrel and did not disappoint. Recently voted best interior (I think) and definitely has a cool vibe. Pretty decent amount of seating outside on the patio too with views of Charlotte skyline. People working the bar were super nice and gave great beer recommendations, they had a couple interesting sours that were fun to try. Very much recommend checking it out!
Motorcycles, workouts, and an amazing west coast ipa. It's a staple for weekly visits, great venue comfy chairs and outdoor space, food trucks and amazing staff.
Petty Thieves makes my Top five breweries in the country list, easily!! This is the best brewery I've been to in a long time. What a fun and superbly decorated space. So quirky and cool cool cool.
Looking for some great beers, a cool atmosphere, and outdoor seating with the Charlotte skyline view? There we go. Several IPAs on tap.
Awesome brewery! Beers are great, they have some AMAZING live music and events, and there's always a super tasty food truck... Check their FB page for their food truck schedule!

I visited this place and was told they needed my credit card as a 'reassurance' I would pay. Totally acceptabkenat this point since they might have had some people leave without paying in the past. I intended to pay with cash, but they refused and charged my card without my knowledge or consent! To add insult to injury, I used their vending machine and it took my money, did Not give me the product, and then gave me $8 in coins as change! Talk about a rip-off. Bad service, unethical business practices, and a faulty vending machine to boot. Avoid this brewery at all costs!"
Love this spot!

Great place. Good beer and a nice environment. Still awesome.
Update 1/27/24: still great
Great facility and ambience.  Lots of chill spots and comfortable furniture.  Huge outdoor area and a Taco food truck.  Really cozy and nice place to hang out with groups of people.
Love the atmosphere
The service is pretty good. Everyone is kind, welcoming,and friendly..They do not have food inside. However, they have food trucks are outside.
Boring for New Year's Eve . Slow moving
Great vibe. Nice folks.  Found a new place to hang out.
Solid beverages.....and the best couches by far!!
The open mic events are awesome! Dylan is super cool and the reason I know of this Brewery. Great place
The food and atmosphere was great.
Great beer and amazing service from our beertender Kiri!
Great brewery with very knowledgeable servers and bartending staff. I found their barrel-aged beers especially good. Highly recommended when in downtown Charlotte!

Went to the Enchanted Bazaar here. They had witchcraft, alchemy, divination, tarot card readings, etc. Fun to learn about different beliefs. Staff at the brewery were so friendly. Very laid back atmosphere. Had a nice outside area to sit back and relax. Recommend!
Menu shows non alcohol options, but I was belittled when I asked.

This brewery has the best views of uptown and the outdoor seating, music is just perfect.
Great beer selection and friendly staff. A must visit and yeah close to uptown for a quick beer after work!
Really cool spot. Love the eclectic atmosphere and what a view of the skyline.  Really enjoyed the varieties of beer and definitely the sour IPA, Augmented Reality. Will definitely be back.

Dude I visited PTBC last week for the first time. Coolest place I've ever been. I've been telling everyone I know about it all week. It's only a 3 minute drive and I'm only just now finding it. As soon as you're walking up to the place you can tel how cool it is. Play some cornhole or horseshoes out front. But then you walk in and the decor, the atmosphere, the furniture. Absolutely phenomenal. The beer is so damn good too. I had 3 different beers and they were all so good. Bought two t shirts to represent.

First time here and we were really disappointed despite the laid back ambience. The website lists a whole line of food available (mostly sausages on French bread, other hot dogs and chips). Turns out they have ZERO food except some pimento cheese and the occasional (overpriced) food truck. Meanwhile, the drink selection is minimal compared to other breweries. They really should update their website to what they honestly serve.

Edited to add: This is my OPINION. Everyone is entitled to one. Ergo, my review (whether or not they update their site and pages) stands as is. Bottom line, our group has enjoyed other breweries (with larger beer selections, better customer service and a heck of a lot less head poured in the glass) more than this place. I have no questions other than why this company gets "all up in their feelings" and wastes time responding negatively to customer replies instead of using them as constructive feedback to improve their business. We didn't like the place. It is obviously good for others. It wasn't good for us. That's all. The end.
-\_ (tsu)_/-
Amazing, came here for the pub brews, stayed for the awesome ambiance and entire beer list slaps....not your average micro brew, love it
Been several times and great beer, friendly servers and the best decor of any brewery in Charlotte

We visited for the first time on 2/4/23 and it will be the first of many visits. What a gem Petty Thieves is. So uniquely inviting with comfortable furniture, tables to play games, and decorations that make it look like they are artsy and pioneers of outback exhibitions. They have an extensive beer list that is not ladened down with a bunch of IPAs  as well as some ciders, seltzers, and other offerings. A food truck is around for hot food.
We came for the Geek Gala Love and Plunder concert featuring Mikey Mason and Valentine Wolfe. We'll be back for more yummy beer.

Petty Thieves is like no other brewery here in Charlotte. We have been going there for a very long time now and have ALWAYS had the best experience with ALL the staff and owners not to mention their beer is amazing. Hands down our favorite brewery in the QC. Keep it weird Petty Thieves.

To start the staff is amazing. Everyone is super friendly and the service is always great.

The beer is also delicious and they have a wide range of choices. They have little snacks you can get or they have a food truck schedule if you wanna try that too!

The vibe is super chill and laid back which I love.

We  love Petty!

The most unique brewery in Charlotte. Love the atmosphere here. The beer and service from staff is always on point. Love that I can come here any weekend and expect a new food truck to try. Love this place!

Followed these guys for years before posting: Absolute treasure for the city of Charlotte - incredible selection and quality that no other brewery can replicate. They obsess over intricacies and make our city a better place. The more this brewery becomes an emblem of Charlotte, the prouder Charlotteans can be.

I wish I lived closer because this is my favorite brewery. They make my favorite dark lager, have books to read, board games to play, corn hole, sometimes live music, a food truck, and always wonderful people. Getting a drink from someone who loves their job and workplace is a great thing and I'm glad I get that here. If you're looking for a new place to see, then look no further. You will be welcomed by both the patrons and the staff.

What a cool spot! Killer views of uptown in a pub meets library meets speakeasy setting. The patio is bomb with tons of seating. Lots to look at and see inside. But seriously, there is a secret room! Say what?! These folks care and it shows in the beer and in every way they present themselves. Tons of fun events & creative beer options. We indulged in beer slushies over trivia and bar snacks last week and had the best time. Always something to do, or do nothing over your beverage of choice here in peace. I love their slogan, Make Charlotte Weird! If you're tired of the shiny things, check this place out. It feels handmade in every awesome way. Bonus, tons of parking... for free! Support the good ones so they can stick around and keep doing what they love.

I think they have the best beer flavors in town, and love the cool ambience. The secret room thing is pretty rad.

My young kids even enjoy the patio area and will play cornhole while I sip a brew.

As a Charlotte native, I've been to a lot of breweries and Petty Thieves Brewing is still the best. The ambiance has everything you could want for a fun and relaxed evening. The drinks are incredible and very reasonable compared to other places. But the best part is the people who make it all happen. I truly have nothing bad I could say about them or what they've created.

Such a fun atmosphere with good beer and great service. The patio area is excellent, but so is the inside. I love the feel of the whole place. My husband and I have tried several of their beers and we've enjoyed them all. If you haven't been before, add it to your list!
Hands down best brewery in Charlotte. Great atmosphere with the coolest staff and simply the best beer in town.
This is a great little place to hangout and have some drinks.  I will definitely be going back soon.
Great beers and atmosphere!!!

One of our favorite places! The place is real chill and relaxed, with a cool mix of super comfy furniture. The skyline view is one of the best of the breweries, abs their beer is quite nice. That have some unique styles and flavors, and do the staples real well too.
Great beer!

Our favorite brewery in Charlotte! Awesome beer selection with some staples and a rotating list. Weird (in a good way!) / chill vibe with a nice patio and great view of the city. Staff is super friendly and always welcoming.

One of the best breweries in Charlotte. Location is right outside the city center with great skyline views and a great sunset if you're lucky! The bar staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and make you feel right at home. Every beer is fantastic and the draft list always has a beer style for everyone! Highly recommend to anyone visiting Charlotte or wanting to check out a newer Charlotte brewery.

Been here countless times as it's our favorite brewery in Charlotte. The customer service is top notch with a laid back feel. I love sour beers and they always keep a few on tap to choose from. They have lots of comfy seating, a covered patio, fire pits, games, and even a secret room. Petty Thieves also has a great view of the Uptown skyline. This place is a must try!!

Our favorite Brewery in Charlotte! Great staff, brews, location, decor, atmosphere and view of the Charlotte skyline. We love being able to bring our dog, have a brew, and play one of their many games available. A true hidden gem. We always take out of town company here and suggest to friends and visitors to stop by.
Petty Thieves is a great local brewery in Charlotte. Great location and unique furnishings. I live nearby and have enjoyed it several times I would encourage anyone to try.
Their beer is incredible, selection is enormous. Definitely one of my favorites to keep on draft at home and even better at the brewery. Hands down my go to brewery. Can't recommend enough! A++++

Probably my favorite brewery in Charlotte. Dog-friendly (inside AND out), great view of the city, unique and cool decor, lots of options for non-drinkers, cheap and fun bar snacks like goldfish and peanut butter pretzels- I could go on for days! It's a place I love going to alone and bringing people to. So glad it exists!
Great vibe and great beer. Still trying to find my way into the secret room
Great local brewery!
Super cool Twin Peaks/library vibe here. Had a really tasty saison when I was around. One of my favorite Charlotte breweries to visit!

One of my favorite breweries in Charlotte and easily the one with the best ambiance. Adds a touch of something different to the Charlotte craft beer scene that's otherwise overwhelmed with "basic" warehouse chic.
Nice place
One of the best breweries in Charlotte. Great atmosphere and drinks!

What an awesome brewery! They have a fiber arts club that meets weekly, which is super cool. But not only that, their beers are absolutely incredible. Of the breweries I visited in Charlotte, Petty Thieves is easily my favourite. The IPAs were fantastic, and it looked like they had a good variety of brews. The atmosphere of the place is super chill and really eclectic. I really enjoyed my time here and it's at the top of my list next time I'm in Charlotte.
Patty knows her beer...

This place is fantastic! They have a nice large outdoor space, the indoor area is comfy and with many couches and armchairs. There's even a secret room behind the bookcase. Good beer selection, and even sours! Yum.
I like the way the place is decorated, but honestly, the service was below par and the beer is average.   Not sure why this place has a 4.8 stars.  Both my wife and I felt the same way about it.
Thanks for supporting the DGR!
One of the greatest places in charlotte, great beer & good vibe
Love the beer and staff....plus they have a secret room! Have fun finding it!

Had a great networking event there last night.  The staff was amazing and I loved the atomospher.  Everyone was super excited about the location and hopefully this gives you new customers!  Thanks as always for being top notch!

Wow. Absolutely speechless at the HORRIBLE customer service I received on 04/20/2023 from the bartender with brown hair who said she was the manager but refused to provide her name. She gave me the owners card and I will be contacting him as this woman needs to be fired and not allowed to work at any other bar.

So first of all I was here attending a Paralegal Conference and was 100% sober. I would never dare attend a business event drunk or under the influence. And I explained this to the bartender. We were given two tokens to use and I had one cider. I finished that drink and went to order another and to my absolute surprise I was cut off! After ONE drink! I asked why I was being cut off and the only explanation I was given was that I was sweating. I told her that I was extremely embarrassed as I have a medical condition called hyperhidrosis that causes my head, neck and armpits to sweat uncontrollably especially when there is temperature changes such as being outside and then going inside to A/C. Mind you, I don't even like drinking. So it was NEVER about the drink and more about my reputation to uphold in front of my firm and their associates. I asked everyone from my group if I was displaying odd behavior and they all said no other than my light sweating.

I would not recommend this bar to anyone and I will add this. Karma is always working. This bar is in the hood. This bar will be shut down in no time. Funny that the name is "Petty Thieves" they ARE petty thieves. They refused to serve my remaining drink I had a token for and did not refund the person paying for all the drinks.

This bar is a joke and furthermore the fact they close at 10 p.m. speaks about the area they are located in. If they stayed open any later than that, due to the location, they would have so much crime and bad customers they would be forced to shut down. But of course their owners are cheap and couldn't afford a location in a nicer spot. So they operate in the hood and hire staff that reflects that.

AVOID THIS BAR AT ALL COSTS!

Witnessed some really bad service against customers during an event tonight. It's not cool to discriminate against people with medical conditions. You shouldn't punish people for things that are out of their control. Needless to say, I will not be back!
Nice

Very friendly and relatively quiet on this visit. Good variety of beer styles (although only one Saison). Disappointed that they now include a Card Service Fee that was only discovered after getting the receipt (not displayed anywhere I could see). Understand low margins but please make charges transparent.

This is my new favorite brewery in Charlotte! Between the adventurous beer styles, great atmosphere and views, and amazing staff, you can't go wrong here.

I've been coming here for a few years now so this review isn't just based on one or two visits. Every time I come here, it has a small town feel where everyone is super friendly and welcoming.

The beer us phenomenal. They experiment with all different styles; not just IPAs and sours like everyone else seems to do. I had a Barleywine just today and it tasted like pie!

Big shout out to Rita. She is our favorite person there and the place wouldn't be the same without her!
Great brewery, wonderful bartenders and a hilarious comedy show on Friday night.
What a unique place to chill! Mismatched library style antique furniture, dimly lit and spacious with some natural light coming through. We've been sitting here for hours and did not want to leave!
Unique ambiance and really good beer. Will def come back

Very cool spot. We randomly stopped by tonight after a crazy-busy Science on the Rocks and were pleasantly surprised by the live acoustic music (and a great Dancing Nancies cover) and spaciousness. We have always loved the beer and my husband had gone many times to pick up cans, but I had never actually been to the brewery. It's really comfortable and eclectic and just a really cool space. The bartenders are super kind and patient. We will be back, of course!

Fantastic!!! Such a cool vibe and the bartenders were awesome and had a great vibe as well. We were in their secret book room, and it was so fun! Definitely will be back to this gem of a brewery. Loved their beer....yum!

One of the best breweries in Charlotte in my experience. They've always got something interesting on tap, but keep their solid crowd pleasers, too. You might walk in on some out of the ordinary entertainment, depending on the night. No matter what, it's always a good time.

Beyind having great beers, Petty Thieves excels at providing a welcoming environment that makes you feel like you're hanging out in your friend's living room. The staff have always been warm and inviting, making you feel comfortable having a beer alone or with a large group. A massive positive about Petty Thieves is that their live music is of quality talent and never so loud that you can't converse with people at the same time.
Unique laid back vibe, great beer, it's like stepping into another dimension. Highly recommend!
One of the coolest breweries in Charlotte.
Could be best spot to grab a beer in the CLT. Really great beer too! Played some great tunes while there.
Old timey European styled pub in Charlotte has great craft beer and amazing pop up food. Fumar was serving BBQ and it was absolutely delicious.
Knowledgeable bartender. Nice atmosphere inside and outside.
Great beer and the atmosphere is top notch. Go check it out!

My experience at this place would have been great if it wasn't for the deplorable customer service I received on 11/22/2022. The taproom has a speakeasy vibe and the beer is good but when told the brewery was "closing soon" my party and I promptly left the hidden room in the back and I put my 3/4 full beer on the bar counter while I went to the restroom. I came back 2 minutes later and my beer was gone. My brother then informed me that the bartender (short, bald guy with tattoos) came up to them and asked if I was going to finish the beer to which he replied "yes, he's just in the bathroom and will be back in a moment." The bartender acknowledged this and went about his business but apparently came back and threw out my beer anyway. I was given no explanation for this or a replacement beer as this all happened over the course of a few minutes while in the bathroom and would have taken even less time to finish the beer after I got back, but the bartender apparently couldn't be bothered to wait another second to finish his duties for the night and instead chose to be quite petty and steal the beer I paid for. If nothing else, at least the name of this place fits the bill...
Good beer, good atmosphere, great staff, and a secret room. Seriously, why wouldn't you just want to stop by, grab a point, and soak up the ambience? Not to mention, try and find the secret room.
Good selection of beer and a friendly comfortable vibe. Highly recommended!

Feels like Harry Potter, meets CS Lewis' library, meets hunting lodge. The vibe is so unique and the beer is great. Always rotating and trying new things. Definitely the most character out of the many many breweries I've been to in Charlotte. Will be coming back and back and back again

What a hidden gem! I found them randomly using the "brewery near me" search, and was amazed when I went in. It's in a bit of a weird location that's not visible from a main street, so I circled around the area for a bit before I could find it.
The beer list is highly creative with a wide range of artistic, almost experimental beers along with some staples. I had an IPA and barrel aged stout and both were amazing. I also bought a to-go Oktoberfest that was also really good.
To me, the venue may have been the best part. There are lots of options for seating from private booths to game tables, to couches and partitioned-off casual areas. This made for a perfect venue to work, hangout with a small group of friends, or have a big gathering. The outdoor seating has a great view of the city, and is set up well to be very welcoming. I didn't go into the "secret room" but I saw some folks going in and out. Very fun feature for sure. I'm not one to usually notice decorations, but I love the vibe in this place. Very creative but welcoming.
I don't come to this part of town often, but if I did, I think this place would be a favorite for sure. Recommend highly.

Great new CLT area brewery. Beautiful interior decor fashioned like a speakeasy throughout including a secret room! Beer offering is excellent with something in many styles for all. Would like it if the big beer list over bar (or staff) told you that not all beers are on tap and they will pour from a can!
UPDATE 9/2022
This brewery continues to excel in good beer. Here to for Oktoberfest, great seasonal variety of beers, great service, fun games, fun seasonal music, tasty food. This place does it right.Prosy!

I attended the 2nd Anniversary event. The female ( dark headed)  beer server was not pleasant or inviting as previous staff members have been on my previous visits. She did not offer up any information about the specials or promotions going on for this special event. I overheard another bartender telling someone else about the beer glass offer. I then asked the female bartender about it upon her return of my drink. I ended up purchasing the glass, but she didnt even bother putting my drink in the glass or filling the glass all the way up.
This was one of my favorite breweries, but I will think twice on subsequent visits if the customer service remains subpar

I've been a customer and fan of Petty Thieves since they first opened up two years ago. Love the laid back funky library vibe, awesome patio with killer views of the Charlotte Skyline, yummy food trucks, and live music. But most importantly, you must try their Joyride now on tap, which is a Cheerwine ice cream float sour. That takes sours to a whole other some kind of wonderful level!!
Perfect!
Great beer! Nice staff! Awesome vibe!

Super awesome place. Decor is amazing and the beer is even better

Rita behind the bar took awesome care of us. You need to be here!
Wife liked their beers, bluegrass was nice, great interior vibe, and had a few wines and N/A selections. We will definitely be back.
Very cozy place. Lovely patio!

You MUST go here. Beer selection is great and the atmosphere/decor is amazing.
There may even be a hidden space to discover

I can't believe it's taken me this long to visit Petty Thieves new space but I'm glad I finally did! Lots of thoughtfully crafted beers on the menu (the "Skyline" was a perfect light lager for this 94 degree day) with interesting vintage decor and an easygoing/low-key atmosphere. 1 minute from Uptown, Camp North End, and the Music Factory with plenty of easy parking out front. I'll be back for sure.

First class place

- with a secret room

I love this place, atmosphere is awesome, good beer and friendly staff. Be sure to check out the secret room. Occasionally live music and food trucks. Furry baby friendly as well as tiny humans (well behaved).
Very unique and amazing taproom ambience! Great beer!
Petty Thieves is one of my favorite breweries. The staff is incredible, the brews are tasty, and the environment is awesome overall.
Top notch brewing, honestly have not been disappointed by any beer recommendations. Plenty of cans for home. Staff is so friendly and helpful! Must visit!

Comfy place , Love decor !!
Make me feel like drinking with friends at the living room.

My favorite Brewing in Charlotte
Sweet decor and layout. Great beer. Wish they did flights during slow times but they do offer 1/2 pours so you can try a lot of stuff.
Ok atmosphere with the exception of people being able to bring dogs inside.
Awesome brewery, great skyline views and (secret) room!
Great time
Great beers and patio, huge fan of the twin peaks themed bathroom, a solid spot that's worth visiting!
Great brewery that's in the cut! Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Has a fire pit and there are usually food trucks or vendors outside as well!
Great atmosphere!  Tasty selections!
Great beers and tap room. Cost for take home beers are way overpriced, though.
Great craft beers and atmosphere. Found a hidden barrel room minutes after arriving.
What a nice place to chill and enjoy a beer or two. Amazing ambiance and friendly staff. Good for families but no food which was ok.

Came here on a Tuesday night tried to order a drink and a inexperienced bartender continued to say my id was fake and would not perform an actual id check as well as told me to come another day very rude establishment
Favorite brewery in Charlotte! Great atmosphere and delicious beer
Best brewery in Charlotte!  Delicious beer and fantastic staff combined with a wonderfully eclectic taproom.  I just wish they would bring back movie night.
Amazingly cool place, great decor and some amazing beers
One of the classiest and most fun taprooms in Charlotte. Great beer too.

This place is phenomenal! Great beer, great staff, and an awesome facility! It's very cozy inside with a warm and interesting aesthetic. The patio is well put together with a big fire pit. Awesome view of the city. I love how it isn't  out in plain sight. It's like a hidden gem, tucked in a corner, to be discovered by those deserving of it

Such a cool space and fantastic beer. Try the fruited sour if that's up your alley! Space is filled the the brim with antiques and art, and there's a few secrets to be found if you keep an eye out. Will definitely be back when I'm in Charlotte again!
Great beer, great atmosphere!
Love the atmosphere and the beers were good

My favorite brewery in Charlotte! There is always a new beer to try and the staff is very friendly and happy to offer suggestions. Unlike most of the breweries in Charlotte, the interior is unique and has hidden gems around the space. Would certainly recommend checking them out.
Really enjoyed Petty Thieves. Friendly staff, unique beers, and a really nice space.
Amazing!! Great brews and friendly service!

Ruca approves. Very laid back and cool atmosphere. The beer was very tasty, nice selection and variety of seasonally appropriate options. Friendly service. Definitely have to come back. Best part was lots of seating and not crowded despite having quite a few people there. Dog friendly inside and out :)
Great drink selection that updates regularly. Rustic decor and live music creates good vibes all around.

Petty Thieves is by far my favorite place in Charlotte. I'm hesitant to talk it up too much because I almost want it to stay like this hidden gem. The people are wonderful, the beer is oh so good, the atmosphere and ambiance is so refreshing and authentic. I love it. I love all of it.
Good flavors
Always fantastic. Great vibe. Great beers. Great people.
Great atmosphere including expansive outdoor space. Quality beers on tap. Beer tender friendly and knowledgeable.
Fun atmosphere! Excellent beer!

Outstanding experience. Excellent beer and a fun atmosphere. Wonderful customer service . I travel a lot and this is a very unique brewery that is warm and cozy and so much fun . I highly recommend and encourage you to give this brewery a try . You will not be disappointed. They have some special surprises that you may be lucky to find out about . In short - one of the top breweries I have ever been to around the nation with exceptional beer - top notch customer service - and just an all around fun time. Thanks for the great visit and most of all - the time you spent with the 4 of us to make this a great experience. You won't be making a mistake if you go here . Enjoy !!!

Petty Thieves is a great spot. The interior is very eclectic and laid back. The outside patio has an amazing view of the Charlotte skyline and plenty of space. Most importantly, the beer was delicious! We have been trying to get here for weeks, but things kept coming up. It was worth the wait. Great sours, solid IPAs, just really solid overall. Highly recommend this spot over a lot of the other breweries in the area!

This brewery is different.  Its a mix of an irish bar, gentleman's club and an industrial space.  It's large but cozy, lots of big leather couches and chairs, many semi private corners, soft light and lots of old books and several games to ease the time in an awkward date .  Beers were good and the snacks appealing.  There was a food truck but it left as we were arriving. Really pleasant terrace outside, with a small touch of Amelies (many chairs from different parents, local place ) And easy parking. We'll definitely be back.
This place is amazing! Staff is fantastic. Didn't want to leave. But the food truck was late
My absolute favorite brewery in Charlotte!

One of the nicest or coolest breweries in Charlotte. They have tons of different beers.. there's a hidden room in this place. All they need now is to make an escape room! Very homey friendly relaxing atmosphere. If Amelie's was a brewery and coffee shop this would be it. Well done. Staff is very friendly well done
Great atmosphere and great beer.
Good beer options/variety, cool ambiance, and friendly staff.

I wish I could give this brewery 10 stars. A group of friends and I had a bottle share last weekend and stayed in the private room, which is awesome by the way. The owners actually brought in homemade pasta salad, pigs in a blanket, and a big crockpot of cheese dip and chips, just because. They were the kindest people I've interacted with at a brewery. I had one of their sour IPA's which was actually one of the best sour ipa's i've ever had. We we're completely blown away with their customer service, beer and hospitality. Also, a HUGE bonus, they have mimosas on Sunday's which is awesome considering my wife doesn't like beer but loves mimosas! Thanks Petty Thieves crew for making our day amazing!!!
If you like beer, goth decor, or a chill hang out place, this is the place for you. Beer is very soild, and the vibe is super chill. Love it.
Very enjoyable evening outside, with sun, music and good beer.
Friendly staff, comfortable airy atmosphere. We go for Jazz night!
Nice dog friendly bar.  Decent taco truck.  Fire pit.  What's not to like?
great atmosphere love the decor.  want to come back in the evening sometime so we can see the city lit up
I loved the warm inviting atmosphere!!!

Came with some coworkers and was thoroughly impressed. Awesome atmosphere, friendly staff, and most importantly very good beer(and cider according to a coworker).  Very good for either large groups, couples, or families (including pets).  Very close to the music factory and my job so I will be visiting very often when quarantine restrictions lift more.
Great ambience indoor/outdoor. Very good brews, anyone can find one to their liking.
Loved it and beer was great
Beautifull tap room... great beer..

Firstly, the beer is very good. I've not had one drink here that I wouldn't have had again. And the variety is excellent. Secondly, the atmosphere is wonderful. Plush leather furniture, rugs, and original warehouse pulley system fixtures inside, and loads of accent pieces on the walls. A patio with wood burning fire pit and solid view of the city. Usually a food truck parked outside. Friendly staff. Great for dogs. And they're constantly doing a whole mess of events. Big fan of pt

Love this place! You would never think this gem is back here.
The beers area great. Awesome views of the city. Staff is nice! Secret rooms!
I really wish they would stay open during the morning hours and run as a coffee shop. I knew they make beer! But still.
Amazing spot
Clever nice misteriou
Fantastic view of the city, great decor, friendly atmosphere
Incredibly comfortable brewery close to uptown Charlotte! Amazing decor with large outdoor patio.

Great atmosphere and with a beautiful view of the skyline
.
Great place to relax with friends and have a beer or three. Ample indoor and outdoor seating, plus great beer options on tap.

Good variety of quality beer and the space is really spacious and unique. The patio space is large with fire pits for the cold seasons and inside has some secluded areas with old church pews. I'm looking forward to going back

Awesome new addition to CLT Northend.  Amazing ambience, paired with tasty beers, the best service.  I love coming here to enjoy the environment with perfect pours.  The Patio is awesome, the layout inside is very cool. Oh and there is a secret lounge to hang out and read a book in, good luck finding it.  The hint is in previous sentence. Awesome fire pits on patio and cool touches with bike racks and tools. Go enjoy this new addition to north side.

Uniquely designed space new to city, but quickly making a name for itself as the neighborhood gentrification continues. There are excellent barrel aged beers from stouts to sours. Nice ambiance and staff.

I've been here only a few times so far and I'm super impressed with their beers and customer service each time. Overall, I appreciate their unique line up of beers compared to a lot of other CLT breweries. They will help set trends soon enough. The saisons are all amazing. Loved the coffee porter on nitro. Their sour IPAs are all badass and unique. I could go on... if you're wanting to find something new and different, go check out this spot. Oh, and it's got a cool atmosphere to top it all off!

These guys have only been open for 4 months and no doubts they're killing it already 

It's a cozy corner, with a secret room, the decor is library-like/English pub  But still a style you'll love! 

Service, attention, and beers were on point there.

we love this place. Its a fun atmosphere and a great place to take in some sunshine on a warm winter afternoon.  I would love it if they could get a good blaze going in the fire pit. we have been here twice, Both times it has just been a smokeout.
Great parking for a Friday night, not overly crowded and spaced out well, great drink variety for beer, food trucks and patio on site

This place gives library lounge vibes perfectly complemented with a large beer selection (and non alcoholic options) and a patio with a picture perfect skyline view. This brewery is no cookie cutter and has been artfully crafted in a way you feel like you are there just among close friends while having plenty of space to be socially distant.
Goth library brewery? Whatever the theme is, cozy atmosphere with great brews and views.
Great beer, great decor!
Simply the best.
Great, Eclectic Brewery. Great beer and an added bonus ... a secret room behind a bookcase!
Flipping awesome my boy

The atmosphere is one that makes one want to sit back and chill.   Excellent variety of delicious beers on tap.  Cider, wine, and kombucha also available.
Food trucks regularly on site.  Follow on Facebook or Instagram to keep- up to date on all the happenings
Beer is pretty good but I've always had a great time everytime I go here
Great location and beers. Very warm feeling with a side of redneck yard sale.
Super cool taproom and great beer!
Good beer, friendly service, cool vibes, awesome view.
Great new place. There's a secret room

It's brand new but it's hands down the best brewery in Charlotte... The staff is pretty cool and the beers are top notch! But, the ambiance and the vibe in the taproom are what's great about this place! If you're there be sure to ask about the secret room, it's pretty much exactly what it sounds like... This place is a gem amougst the stones that are the dozens of breweries now located in Charlotte. When showing people around town, this is now on the top of the list to take people. I'm glad I found this place

Awesome new brewery on the outskirts of town. Excellent beer list, friendly service, and great views of Uptown. Pro tip: they do half pours of all their beers if you want to try a few different ones. The raspberry sour and kolsch were our favorites.

It only took one time for this place to easily be my new favorite brewery in Charlotte. My fiance and I are true craft beer connoisseurs and this place has some amazing brews! Chill and comfy ambience with a great view of the skyline. Not to mention unmatched and friendly bartenders. Oh and did I mention they have an array of $2 snacks?
Great variety of beers on tap and the atmosphere. Oh man the atmosphere is so fun and chill. But then you look outside to one of the best views of the city skyline!
Great place... Similar to jekyl and hydes... Just less steampunk... And more secret rooms passageways.. Kinda stuff....
Both Rita and Jenna are so sweet and helpful! Love it here!
Nice brewery near uptown. Good beers and nice indoor outdoor seats with great view.

Wrong brewery. Can't delete. Sorry!

Mediocre beer and boring tap room.  Location is ok.
New Charlotte brewery.   Great atmosphere with friendly staff.  Beers i had were good.  Will definitely be coming back for more.

The most stunning brewery in town! Love the thought/idea behind the whole brewery space and design. It's very unique and offers a whole assortment of creative beer flavors. Great patio for an open-air option. Five stars!!

The beer that I've tried seems to be right on par with the best breweries in Charlotte and even Asheville. The decor and aesthetics of the place are awesome. A great place to catch a drink outside and chill.

I 100% support this Brewery. Great beer, homey atmosphere, and secrets to behold. "I have no idea where this will lead us, but I have a definite feeling it will be a place both wonderful and strange."
Top quality beer, luxurious taproom, unmatched service, and everlasting soul.
